description: Analyzes webpack bundle size when webpack config or entry files are modified
author: JSONbored
features: Interactive bundle size visualization and analysis
Automatic bundle analysis on configuration changes
Support for multiple build tools (Webpack, Vite, Rollup)
useCases: Analyze bundle size after webpack configuration changes
Identify large dependencies impacting bundle size
Optimize bundle splitting and code splitting strategies
Track bundle size over time for performance monitoring
Optimize tree-shaking and dead code elimination
Compare before/after bundle sizes for optimization

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/bin/bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

echo "ðŸ“Š Webpack Bundle Analyzer - Analyzing bundle performance..."
echo "ðŸ“„ File: $FILE_PATH"

# Check if this is a relevant file for bundle analysis
RELEVANT_FILE=false

if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *webpack.config.js ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *webpack.config.ts ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *vite.config.js ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *vite.config.ts ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *rollup.config.js ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *src/index.js ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *src/index.ts ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *src/main.js ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *src/main.ts ]] || \
   [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *package.json ]]; then
    RELEVANT_FILE=true
fi

if [ "$RELEVANT_FILE" = false ]; then
    echo "â„¹ï¸ File does not require bundle analysis: $FILE_PATH"
    exit 0
fi

echo "ðŸ” Detecting build system and configuration..."

# Detect build system
BUILD_SYSTEM="unknown"
if [ -f "webpack.config.js" ] || [ -f "webpack.config.ts" ]; then
    BUILD_SYSTEM="webpack"
    echo "ðŸ“¦ Webpack configuration detected"
elif [ -f "vite.config.js" ] || [ -f "vite.config.ts" ]; then
    BUILD_SYSTEM="vite"
    echo "âš¡ Vite configuration detected"
elif [ -f "rollup.config.js" ] || [ -f "rollup.config.ts" ]; then
    BUILD_SYSTEM="rollup"
    echo "ðŸŽ¯ Rollup configuration detected"
elif [ -f "package.json" ] && grep -q '"react-scripts"' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
    BUILD_SYSTEM="cra"
    echo "âš›ï¸ Create React App detected"
elif [ -f "next.config.js" ] || [ -f "next.config.ts" ]; then
    BUILD_SYSTEM="next"
    echo "ðŸ”º Next.js configuration detected"
else
    echo "â“ No recognized build system found"
fi

# Check for bundle analyzer availability
ANALYZER_AVAILABLE=false
if command -v npx >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if npx webpack-bundle-analyzer --version >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        ANALYZER_AVAILABLE=true
        echo "âœ… webpack-bundle-analyzer available"
    else
        echo "âš ï¸ webpack-bundle-analyzer not available - install with: npm install --save-dev webpack-bundle-analyzer"
    fi
else
    echo "âš ï¸ npx not available - please install Node.js"
fi

# Perform bundle analysis based on build system
case "$BUILD_SYSTEM" in
    "webpack")
        echo "ðŸ“Š Analyzing Webpack bundle..."
        
        # Check if dist directory exists
        if [ ! -d "dist" ] && [ ! -d "build" ]; then
            echo "ðŸ—ï¸ Building project to generate bundle..."
            if npm run build 2>/dev/null; then
                echo "âœ… Build completed successfully"
            else
                echo "âŒ Build failed - cannot analyze bundle"
                exit 1
            fi
        fi
        
        # Find stats file or generate one
        STATS_FILE=""
        if [ -f "dist/stats.json" ]; then
            STATS_FILE="dist/stats.json"
        elif [ -f "build/stats.json" ]; then
            STATS_FILE="build/stats.json"
        else
            echo "ðŸ“ˆ Generating webpack stats..."
            if npx webpack --profile --json > webpack-stats.json 2>/dev/null; then
                STATS_FILE="webpack-stats.json"
                echo "âœ… Stats file generated: $STATS_FILE"
            else
                echo "âŒ Failed to generate webpack stats"
                exit 1
            fi
        fi
        
        # Run bundle analyzer
        if [ "$ANALYZER_AVAILABLE" = true ] && [ -n "$STATS_FILE" ]; then
            echo "ðŸ” Running bundle analysis..."
            if npx webpack-bundle-analyzer "$STATS_FILE" --mode static --report bundle-report.html --no-open 2>/dev/null; then
                echo "âœ… Bundle analysis completed"
                echo "ðŸ“Š Report saved to: bundle-report.html"
                echo "ðŸŒ View report: file://$(pwd)/bundle-report.html"
            else
                echo "âš ï¸ Bundle analysis failed"
            fi
        fi
        ;;
    "vite")
        echo "âš¡ Analyzing Vite bundle..."
        
        # Check if Vite has bundle analysis plugin
        if grep -q 'vite-bundle-analyzer\|rollup-plugin-analyzer' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
            echo "ðŸ“Š Running Vite bundle analysis..."
            if npm run build -- --analyze 2>/dev/null; then
                echo "âœ… Vite bundle analysis completed"
            else
                echo "âš ï¸ Vite bundle analysis failed"
            fi
        else
            echo "ðŸ’¡ Install vite-bundle-analyzer for detailed analysis:"
            echo "    npm install --save-dev vite-bundle-analyzer"
            
            # Basic build size analysis
            echo "ðŸ“ Running basic build analysis..."
            if npm run build 2>/dev/null; then
                if [ -d "dist" ]; then
                    echo "ðŸ“Š Build output analysis:"
                    find dist -name "*.js" -exec du -h {} \; | sort -hr | head -10
                fi
            fi
        fi
        ;;
    "next")
        echo "ðŸ”º Analyzing Next.js bundle..."
        
        if grep -q '@next/bundle-analyzer' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
            echo "ðŸ“Š Running Next.js bundle analysis..."
            if ANALYZE=true npm run build 2>/dev/null; then
                echo "âœ… Next.js bundle analysis completed"
            else
                echo "âš ï¸ Next.js bundle analysis failed"
            fi
        else
            echo "ðŸ’¡ Install @next/bundle-analyzer for detailed analysis:"
            echo "    npm install --save-dev @next/bundle-analyzer"
        fi
        ;;
    "cra")
        echo "âš›ï¸ Analyzing Create React App bundle..."
        
        if npm list --depth=0 | grep -q 'source-map-explorer' 2>/dev/null; then
            echo "ðŸ“Š Running source-map-explorer..."
            if npm run build && npx source-map-explorer 'build/static/js/*.js' 2>/dev/null; then
                echo "âœ… CRA bundle analysis completed"
            else
                echo "âš ï¸ CRA bundle analysis failed"
            fi
        else
            echo "ðŸ’¡ Install source-map-explorer for detailed analysis:"
            echo "    npm install --save-dev source-map-explorer"
        fi
        ;;
    *)
        echo "â“ Unknown build system - attempting generic analysis"
        
        # Try to analyze any existing build output
        for dir in dist build public; do
            if [ -d "$dir" ]; then
                echo "ðŸ“Š Analyzing $dir directory:"
                find "$dir" -name "*.js" -o -name "*.css" | head -10 | while read -r file; do
                    size=$(du -h "$file" 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
                    echo "  â€¢ $file: $size"
                done
            fi
        done
        ;;
esac

# General optimization suggestions
echo ""
echo "ðŸ’¡ Bundle Optimization Tips:"
echo "  â€¢ Enable tree-shaking to remove unused code"
echo "  â€¢ Use dynamic imports for code splitting"
echo "  â€¢ Optimize images and static assets"
echo "  â€¢ Use compression (gzip/brotli) for production"
echo "  â€¢ Analyze and remove large unnecessary dependencies"
echo "  â€¢ Use webpack-bundle-analyzer for detailed insights"
echo "  â€¢ Consider lazy loading for non-critical components"
echo "  â€¢ Review and optimize polyfills"

echo ""
echo "ðŸ“Š Bundle Analysis Tools:"
echo "  â€¢ Webpack: webpack-bundle-analyzer"
echo "  â€¢ Vite: vite-bundle-analyzer"
echo "  â€¢ Next.js: @next/bundle-analyzer"
echo "  â€¢ CRA: source-map-explorer"
echo "  â€¢ General: bundlephobia.com for dependency analysis"

echo ""
echo "ðŸŽ¯ Bundle analysis complete!"

exit 0
